Name: Establishing ferry service at Canarsie Pier.
Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to establishing ferry service at Canarsie Pier

History.Description: This Introduction was Introduced by Council
This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure

Summary: This bill would require the establishment of a regular ferry service at Canarsie Pier in the borough of Brooklyn.
Text:
Be it enacted by the Council as follows:
      
      
      Section 1. Chapter 3 of title 19 of the administrative code of the city of New York is amended by adding a new section 19-309 to read as follows:
      � 19-309 Ferry service required. a. The mayor shall ensure that regular ferry service is established and maintained at Canarsie Pier in the borough of Brooklyn and shall designate either a city agency or a contracted entity, as such term is defined in section 22-821, to manage or operate such service.
      b. Such service shall be open to the public and be integrated with the city's existing ferry system to the maximum extent practicable.
      � 2. This local law takes effect 1 year after it becomes law.



LMH
LS #18829
5/8/2025
